title: Breaking: Binance's CZ pleads guilty to violating anti-money laundering requirements—WSJ
description:
Changpeng Zhao plans to plead guilty to violating U.S. anti-money laundering requirements and will reportedly step down as the CEO of the Binance crypto exchange.

Binance founder Changpeng "CZ" Zhao has agreed to step down as CEO of the crypto exchange as the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) prepares to announce that it's secured a $4.3 billion settlement with the company.

According to The Wall Street Journal, CZ intends to plead guilty to several charges levied by the DOJ. He's scheduled to appear in a federal court in Seattle Tuesday afternoon, where he will enter his plea, the Journal said. The report also indicates that he will plead guilty to "one criminal charge." 

Although the deal would allow CZ to retain his majority stake in Binance, he won't be allowed to hold an executive position at the company. 

The Wall Street Journal also reports that this plea deal won't affect pendi

This is a developing story, and further information will be added as it becomes available.

title: Anthropic halves hallucinations, adds 200k context as it launches Claude 2.1 with API access
description:
With OpenAI in turmoil, rival Anthropic has released its latest model, Claude 2.1, which it says sets a new benchmark in artificial intelligence, particularly in its application within enterprise environments. title: Is $3 a Distant Dream for NEAR Protocol (NEAR)? Analysts Offer Mixed Views
description: Dive into the world of NEAR Protocol (NEAR) as it traverses the unpredictable crypto market. Our analysis focuses on the divided expert opinions regarding the NEAR price's potential to hit the $3 target amidst its fluctuating fortunes. Offering a balanced perspective, we explore the chances of a bullish rise or a bearish fallback, providing essential insights for anyone navigating the dynamic and often uncertain terrain of cryptocurrency investments.

title: WSJ: Changpeng Zhao to step down, plead guilty as part of Binance-DoJ settlement
description: In reports from Forbes and the Wall Street Journal, sources familiar with the matter state that Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao will be forced to step down from his role at the world’s largest exchange as part of a $4.3 billion settlement.

title: Telegram trading bot Banana Gun exceeds daily volume of $16m
description: According to recent data compiled on Dune Analytics, Banana Gun, a Telegram DEX trading bot, has shown daily trading volume of over $16 million.
